ROScpp node - position_service

Service for Random Pose.

ROS Node Name

  • random_position_server

Description:
Authors

Carmine Tommaso Recchiuto, Francesco Ganci (S4143910)

Version

v1.0

The service can return a (x, y) position randomly generated using bounds specified in the request.

The service can generate also an angle around Z axis, already noramlized in [-pi, pi].

Services:

  • /position_server

    : RandomPosition.srv

    Ask for a new random plane position (with bounds) and orientation about Z axis (no bounds, normalized).

Functions

double randMToN(double M, double N)

generate a random number between a minimum and a maximum.

Parameters

  • M – the minimum value, included

  • N – the maximum value, included

Returns

uniform random number in [M, N]

bool myrandom(rt2_assignment_2::RandomPosition::Request &req, rt2_assignment_2::RandomPosition::Response &res)

implementation of service “/position_server”

See also

RandomPosition.srv

Parameters

  • req – the bounds for the planar coordinates

  • res – a pose {x, y, th_z}

int main(int argc, char **argv)

ROS node main - position_service.cpp.

A trivial main function: init the node, advertise the service, then spin. NO OUTPUT on the screen is provided.
